name.en: Product Design Methods and Pratice II

goal.en: "The focus of this 2-semesters-course is to introduce methodology for designing and developing technical products, and concerned with the problem formulation, the conceptual and the embodiment stage of design, rather than detail deign. The course is intended to provide you: Some new but important concepts for innovation and product design, e.g., design thinking, interaction design; General procedure of product design and development, and also methodical steps, from clarifying and specifying tasks, to finding and selecting solutions, until implementing the developed concepts based on marketing view point. A set of tools and methods for product design and development; Integration of important parameters in creating a new product (e.g. marketing, finance, engineering, production, quality control etc.)"

content.en:
"4. Clarifying the Task
LT09 Identifying the Requirements for Product Concepts: Importance of identifying the requirements; How to Identifying the Requirements; Requirement List
5. Methodical Development of Principle Solution
LT10 Methods for Solution Finding: Fundamentals of Problem?Solving Methods; Design from Nature; Thinking and Acting Operations
LT11 Systematic Combination of Solutions : Fundamental of Morphological Chart; Generating Morphological Chart; Strategies for Convergence of Solutions
LT12 Function Structures for Product Concepts: Fundamentals of Function Structures; General Function Structures; Working with Function Structures
LT13 Abstraction and Realization: Graphic Representation & Symbolization; Abstraction & Variation of Concepts; Variation of Mechanism
LT14 Designing Using Physical Effects: Fundamental of Physical Effects; Design Method using Physical Effects; Example: Stone Thrower
LT15 Designing Using Logical Functions: Boolean Algebra; Logical Function Structure; Example: Children Safety Lock in Automotive
6. Methods for Evaluating of Solutions
LT16 Methods for Evaluating and Selecting of Solutions: Introduction to Engineering Evaluation; Technical?Economic Evaluation; Use?Value Analysis
7. Embodiment Design
LT17 Fundamental of Embodiment Design: What is Embodiment Design; Working Methods for Embodiment Design; Basic Rules of Embodiment Design,
LT18 Principles for Embodiment Design: Force Transmission; Division of Tasks; Self-Help; Fault Free Design; Friction Systems; Tolerance; Function Integration and Function Separation; Thermal Deformation
LT19 DFX & Green Design: DFX; Design using Plastics; Green Design
8. Product Design Management
LT20 Product Variants Management: Size Range Development; Modular Products
LT21 Cost Management for Product Design: Cost Types; Cost Calculation; Early Identification of Cost; Rules for Cost Reduction"
